Excellent film, similar in vein to Sean of the Dead. Its meant to be a light-hearted, comedic film. It is very funny although a lot of the humour is British-language based so I can understand why other people may not understand it.

To people saying this is a terrible film, I simply think you don't understand what it is meant to be. This is not a horror or thriller type film, it's an entertainment film. I just finished watching it and can say safely its one of the finest British films in a long, long time - and you need look no further than the critics 89% fresh rating on Rotten Tomatoes to verify that.

Haters always gon' hate. Especially ones that are too stupid to understand what they are watching. Although it always amazes me that people insist on telling the internet how much they hate something, as if anyone cares. Ironic statement is ironic. Deal with it, I'm post-modern bitch.

Just to say this film had good things about it, these include: Nick Frost, Aliens that look like the ones off the Space Invaders arcade cabinet.

What spoiled it for me was the fact that the "heroes" of the piece are a bunch of irredeemably horrid little sh1ts who blatantly need killing.

The maker of this film (Joe Cornish of Adam and Joe) obviously thinks a woman getting robbed at knifepoint is the sort of thing that makes these kids antiheroes. Perhaps with his place in life, he doesn't often worry about being robbed - and if he was would quickly replace his items and blame it on them not having enough after school clubs etc.

I always wondered how the scatter section of the underclass morally justifies their criminal actions against innocent members of society. This film answers it, they shrug, laugh about it, then trot off to play FIFA on the EXPENSIVE GAMES CONSOLES they are supposedly too impoverished to afford.

The main characters are hateful scratbags who need to be shot on sight for their complete lack of morality and general empty headed c*ntishness.

This made it hard for me to get into an otherwise okay movie. 

Hot Fuzz and Shaun of the Dead are MUCH BETTER FILMS. End of. Joe Cornishes earlier comedy work, such as The adam and Joe show are well worth it as well. This just isn't quite there.

Thanks for the quality upload though, of course.
